events.name: Front End TL;DR July 2015
events.description: Skyscanner, a house hold name for travellers, hosts FEDS TL;DR this month. Many of us are their customers -- now we can catch a glimpse of the talented people behind the app. FEDS is about hands-on, collaborative learning. Join the session if you'd like to learn new front end technology. To enter the building, you need not to register, but just go to 9th floor and look for Ardy. We will host the event at “Borobudur/George Town” room. Schedule: Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. 7:00pm — Arrival, registration, seating 7:10pm — Intro talk 7:30pm — Teams work on mini challenges 8:30pm — Presentations, awards 9:00pm — The end. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/ PS: Bring a laptop and show up a bit earlier to get set up on the wifi (and grab some food).
events.location: Skyscanner Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #011
events.description: Paper #1: On computable numbers, with an application to the Entscheidungsproblem : Melvin Zhang - http://www.cs.virginia.edu/~robins/Turing_Paper_1936.pdf Paper #2: Oberon System Implemented on a Low-Cost FPGA Board : Michał - http://www.xilinx.com/publications/archives/xcell/Xcell91.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: SoftLayer SG Meetup #1: Globalize your startup with IBM SoftLayer
events.description: Globalize your startup with IBM SoftLayer Target Audience: Founders (CEOs/CTOs) primarily of the more mature startups that already have a somewhat successful solution (mobile app / big data etc) in selling & production / ready for globalization Description: Have you successfully funded and launched your product and started to get some good traction in your home market? Thinking about taking your product global, starting with China, Australia, Europe or US? Get an insight on startup globalization strategies and learn how you can leverage SoftLayer's global datacenters and free of charge Global Private Network to dramatically lower cost to deliver your product to new markets quickly with outstanding response times in any of these markets. Agenda: 5:30-6:45 pm: Registration & Presentation in a Breakout room on Level 2 6:45-7:30 pm at the Cook & Brew for Beers & Snacks
events.location: Cook & Brew Gastrobar, The Westin Singapore, 12 Marina View, Asia Square Tower 2, Level 33

events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description: We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance This week we'll be covering Chapter 11 & Chapter 12: HTTP/1.X & HTTP/2.X Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong Rd Singapore 437032 Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Live coding show in Haskell
events.description: Live coding a simple game using Netwire - Andreas Granström Netwire is Functional Reactive Programming library https://hackage.haskell.org/package/netwire 101 talk for real beginners: Algebraic datatypes - Sönke Hahn
events.location: SkyScanner Ltd, 39 Robinson Road #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore

events.name: Makers Meet Designers
events.description: Makers meet the Designers Creative Crew Singapore is the official Adobe User Group in Singapore. We are also a non-profit organisation and we hold our monthly talks at Toa Payoh Library. In this special meetup at One Maker Group, Creative Crew will be bringing together our most experienced members to give a brief introduction of the various different Adobe Software in the Adobe Creative Cloud. We will answer common questions such as: - When do I use photoshop and when do I use illustrator? - What is the difference between Premier Pro and After Effects? - What can you do with Adobe Indesign? There will also be a QnA session at the end. RSVP http://peatix.com/event/101222
events.location: National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road National Design Centre #01-02 Singapore

events.name: Get comprehesive App Performance and User insights - #DynatraceTestDrive
events.description: Dynatrace is offering a new personal license that will give you the opportunity to debug your application locally. This is an excellent news for developers trying to troubleshoot applications locally. Take the most trusted APM for a test drive. Only 3 steps (Install, Connect and Analyse) to start analysing the performance of your applications and get : - Transactions flow PurePath from device and database - Auto diagnostic dashboard that highlight where and why your application breaks - Visibility into your application performance issues as to whether it is code or deployment related - Ability to diagnose root causes down to the method level Please bring along a laptop with 8GB RAM and 20GB hard disk with window OS if you would like to follow through the the Test Drive with us. (Feel Free to join us even if you are not able to bring your laptop)
events.location: The Co, 75 High Street  Singapore , 179435 Singapore

events.name: Hackware v0.9
events.description: Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. Agenda & Talks for this meetup: 1. High Level Synthesis tools - Augustine Koh 2. FPGA 101 - Michał J. Gajda​ (Lightning) 3. ?? - Andreas Schlegel 4. Cupcade - Kenneth Yong (Lightning) Socialize and Network with other Hackware members. Talks : ~20mins. Lightning Talks : ~5mins.
events.location: iDA Labs @National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #03-04, Singapore 188969

events.name: Humla Workshop -  Advanced Application Security Testing with Burp Pro
events.description: We are pleased to inform our second humla workshop on Advanced Application Security Testing with Burp Pro by Sven. Please register ( required ) using below link for the workshop. As this event is hands-on, we can accommodate only few selected participants. If you get selected, you will receive a mail from humla champion by 20th July 2015. Register link: http://advancedburphumla.eventbrite.com Agenda: a) General Tips and Tricks b) Burp Collaborator explained in detail c) Creating and Handling of Macros / Session Handling Rules d) Tips and Tricks discovered during pentest engagements (e.g. circumvent transaction based CSRF tokens when using Active Scan of Burp) e) Using Burp Extensions (No development) Who should attend: Everybody that is interested in Penetration testing with Burp Suite Professional. The workshop will not explain Burp 101, therefore basic experience in Burp is highly recommended. What should I bring with me: Your own laptop, with latest version of Burp Suite Professional [masked] at the moment). If you only have Burp Suite Free Edition, not all exercises can be fully covered. Null humla champion: Sven Schleier is an Assistant Manager within KPMG Management Consulting (MC) Singapore and an experienced IT-Consultant in the field of Information Security, specialized in penetration testing of complex web applications. He is a Unix (and VIM) enthusiast since 1999 and was using Net|Free|Open-BSD heavily in his freelancer time back in Germany. When he is not at work he is spending time with his 2 year old daughter and cannot wait till she is old enough to build their first robot together and code some AI. Please reach out to humla champion at [masked] if you have any questions regarding the event.
events.location: Conference room “Blubox II” (20th floor), Hong Leon Building, 16 Raffles Quay, near Lau Pa Sat, Singapore
events.group_name: Null Singapore - The Open Security Community

events.name: iOS Dev Scout July Meetup
events.description: Venue: PlugIn@BLK71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-18, Singapore -[masked] Nearby MRT: One-north Speakers: 1st Session: TBD 2nd Session: Subh Agenda: 7:00 PM: 1st Session (TBD) 7:45 PM: 2nd Session on what's new in watchOS by Subh I've attended every single WWDC sessions on watchOS this year, spoke to the Apple engineers at the labs and then attended a watch Hackathon where we created this app in few hours: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lKwhIC6Qv3E There are a lot of new APIs and features in the new watchOS. I will share more in detail how to build some of these things. 8:30PM: Show & Tell by members
events.location: Plugin@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent,  #02-18, Singapore 139951

events.name: DataLearn: Earth Hour + HOME DataDive Sharing
events.description: In late April, we held a DataDive where our volunteers spent a weekend to deliver data solutions for Earth Hour and HOME. This DataLearn event will include several of the participants of the DataDive sharing the methods and techniques they had used during the DataDive. The objective of the session is to get the overall community even better prepared for our next DataDive. It will be a relaxed overview from different people, and at the end we'll have a discussion on what you want to see in future DataLearn sessions. Date : 23 Jul (Thu) Time : Registration starts from 6.45pm (Event starts at 7pm) Special Thanks to our supporter PayPal Singapore for their generous food and venue sponsorship! Pizza will be served at the event. Format • 70 minutes sharing on Earth Hour • 70 minutes sharing on HOME • Questions are encouraged throughout the sharing sessions, and we'll end with a 15-20 minute discussion on what you want to see in future DataLearn sessions • No data will be shared; only sharing of methods and techniques Registration (ACTION NEEDED) Besides signing up on this meetup event, you are required to provide your particulars on this Google form for building security purposes. If we reach the event capacity, we'll be giving priority to people who were at the DataDive. See you there!
events.location: PayPal Singapore, 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 9, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: Technical Workshop: Solar Thermal Cooling in Data Center
events.description: About the Trainer Mr. Harald Blazek has been with SOLID since 2008 and is currently in charge of Strategic Business Development & Marketing. SOLID is currently one of the leading system integrator for Large Scale Solar Thermal (LST) installations and has worldwide experience in designing, installing & commissioning LST systems adapted to local climates that have not a single failed system in more than 250 installations during the past 2 decades. Harald has over 7 years experience as a speaker on different international conferences and also held various trainings on Solar Thermal topics in Europe & Africa. He has also recently completed a six month stint in Singapore as the Head of SOLID’s Research & Development Team which jointly established a Solar Thermal research laboratory with Energy Research Institute @ Nanyang Technological University (ERI@N). About the Workshop: Singapore is a small city-state without natural resources such as oil and natural gas. Fortunately, we are blessed with plenty of sunshine throughout the year. When adopting a renewal solar energy system, a Large scale Solar Thermal (LST) system helps to reduce the use of fossil fuels and improves the building environmental performance. LST systems which convert the Free & Sustainable Solar Energy from the Sun to produce energy in the form of (Solar Thermal) Heat are designed to provide energy input directly to meet the local consumer’s energy requirement. Hence, a LST system helps not only to reduce the reliance on the conventional energy inputs, ie. electricity and natural gas, but could also be independent & enjoy security from any future dramatic changes in oil prices. Singapore is also a land scarce country and the optimization of available spaces is of utmost importance when evaluating the adoption of the most technologically feasible and economically viable renewable energy system. Apart from being more efficient in harvesting solar energy as compared to other alternatives, a LST system is very simple to operate and has a long operating life requiring minimum maintenance thus making a LST system an attractive renewable system that is able to optimize the use of space in Singapore. A LST system will also make the building unique and further enhances the owner’s Clean & Green image. Apart from various attractive project financing schemes from banks & other international financial institution at competitive rates, aspiring LST system end-users could tap into the alternative Energy Service Contracting (ESCo) option that offer minimum upfront investments. An ESCo is structured as a service that not only reduce operating costs & transfer risk but also allow building owners to concentrate attention on their core activities. Many aspiring LST systems owners find themselves poorly prepared when requesting system proposals and evaluating offers, as they might have little or no prior experience of LST systems and what levels of payback and incentive schemes apply. Hence, two experienced Solar Thermal industry professionals are invited to clear your doubts. Objectives of the workshop: At the end of the programme, participants will understand: • the fundamentals of Solar Thermal technology • the difference between Solar Thermal and Solar PV technologies • the possibilities and limitations of Solar Thermal applications in Data Center and Commercial buildings. • the economics and payback of Large Scale Solar Thermal (LST) systems • how to specify and evaluate LST project proposals Target Audience • Data Center Facility Managers • Building owners • Developers • Architects • Contractors • Government agencies Programme Outline The half-day workshop will comprise a mix of presentations and interactive discussions: 1. Technical Topics • Introduction and overview of Solar Thermal Technology and Large Scale Solar Thermal System • Comparison large scale vs small scale, flat plate vs tube • Comparison between Solar Thermal and PV – relevance to land scarce country like Singapore • Applications: Data Center, Commercial Solar Cooling 2. Project Evaluation • Economics and LCOE/ROI analysis • Project Financing • ESCo • Identifying and evaluating projects • Maintenance requirements and programmes 3. Q&A Session & General Discussions
events.location: Datwyler, 30 Toh Guan Road #01-01A (Opp IMM, near Furniture Mall).  , Singapore

events.name: Singapore SQL Server User Group - July meetup
events.description: Topics for 24th July: Hekaton - in memory tables and SQL AlwaysOn. Speaker: Mr. Nagaraj Venkatesan About speaker: I am Nagaraj, a SQL Server enthusiast exploring SQL Server for the last 10 years. Working for NCS Pte Ltd as SQL Server DBA, I maintain databases used by one of the busiest public facing applications in the city. I blog at strictlysql.blogspot.com and a regular contributor/ visitor at sqlservercentral.com . Besides these, I hold a Masters Degree in Computing from National University of Singapore Topic: "Hekaton - In memory tables" introduced in SQL Server 2014 is a game changer in database performance especially in OLTP systems. The presentation would cover the major architectural changes on "In memory tables", compared to traditional disk based tables, on concepts like transaction processing, indexing and storage structures and how "In memory tables" can help one achieve performance gain in OLTP systems. Besides these, the presentation would also discuss pros and cons of "In memory tables", for whom it suits and whom it doesn't , key prerequisites and things to consider before migrating to "In memory tables". Speaker: Pio Riva Balistoy About Speaker: Pio has more than a decade of DBA experience. He was a Team lead for Accenture CIO Global DBA Team before moving to Singapore to work for Dupont and Resorts World Sentosa. He is currently a Lead Database consultant for Pythian, a global IT Services company that specializes in database technology. Topic: AlwaysOn Availability Group were introduced in SQL Server 2012. The session aims to give an quick guide on Availability Groups, what it is, its usage, its components and how to configure it. It will also give an update on the changes/improvements in the succeeding versions. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Venue: As shown below. Level : 22 Room : Conf Room 22CF-12
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: International NodeBots Day (Singapore)
events.description: International NodeBots Day is a world-wide initiative to gather together and share the love and passion for NodeJS and Robotics. The Singapore edition will be a full-day event where people learn to make NodeBots and program them using Node.js. NodeBots Day is not a hackathon. There will be no prizes other than the satisfaction of making something awesome! There will be very little in the way of talks. We're going to get together, collaborate and hack. The focus of NodeBots Day is on sharing and enjoying each other's company. And JavaScript. Lots of JavaScript. https://github.com/nodebots/nodebotsday Sumo Robot Kit Item List * Ardiuno Nano * Small Breadboard * CR Servo motors (360 Degrees rotation) (DSC04-NFC) * Ultrasonic Sensor * AA 4 Batteries and Battery Holder * Mini USB Cable * Micro Switch (Bumper) * Cable ties * M-F Jumper wires * M-M Jumper Wires * Normal small wires- 10m * Small Switches * 330 Ohm Resisters * Cardboard and Wheels
events.location: IDA Labs Level 2 @ National Design Centre, 111 Middle Road, #02-04, Singapore

events.name: A look at IP issues arising in 3D printing and a close-up on Objects Scanning
events.description: Did you know what implications you would face when downloading a 3D model to print? Come hear from a practicing IP lawyer and see first-hand the latest Matter and Form 3D scanner for objects scanning.
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Conversations: Creating New Realities, Animation Now and Next
events.description: Saturday 25th July 2015 11.00am to 5.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE. Attendance is on a first come, first served basis. Creating New Realities: Animation Now and Next Celebrating DreamWorks Animation: The Exhibition at ArtScience Museum, this event invites animators and animation thought-leaders to reflect on animation and storytelling. A panel of Singaporean thought-leaders in the field will share their own insights and present the latest innovations in animation, and consider how animation might develop and change in the future. Curated by Michael Lim Organized in partnership with the Singapore Film Society. Programme: 11.00am - Opening and Welcome address by Michael Lim, Curator and Chris Shaw, LaSalle College of the Arts. Talk 1: 11.10am - The Challenge of Dreaming in the Animation World. Speaker - Jacques Frety, Nanyang Polytechnic. Since its creation, Animation has always been fascinated with imaginary characters and worlds, with the public more and more trained to the new technologies of images, how will the artists continue to make us dream. Talk 2: 11.50am - Character Animation: from hyper real to stylized, defining worlds. Speaker - Juan Jose Guiraldes, Senior Animator This talk will be centered around various examples, both of fully CG films, all the way to the most popular VFX films, and how the use of character animation is used in the creation of these complex and rich worlds. Also, how the use of motion capture can help this art form to reach new heights when it is used correctly. 12.30pm – 1.30pm - Lunch Break Talk 3: 1.30pm – Finding Stories and Identity through Animation: A Singaporean Perspective. Speaker - Ervin Han, Robot Playground Media A look at how animation can be used as a storytelling tool for education and forging national identity across different generations. Talk 4: 2.10pm – Music And Sound In Animation. Speaker - Alex Oh, Film Composer The role of music and sound in animation and how it creates a 'reality'. 2.50 – Tea Break Talk 5: 3.05pm – Growing an Animation Festival today for tomorrow’s audience. Speaker - Vicky Chen, Cartoons Underground Learn how to build a community and platform for young talents to connect with a large audience and experienced leaders. 3.45pm – 4.15pm – Panel discussion, all Speakers moderated by Chair. 4.15pm – Closing remarks from Michael Lim, Curator and Chair, Chris Shaw. 4.30pm – Tour of DreamWorks Exhibition 5.30pm – Event ends.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: [talk] Asia Pacific Virtual Reality Network (Singapore Base)
events.description: The APVRN strives to connect all virtual reality meetups within the Asia Pacific region to form a single network, which provides support and education to local communities. The ultimate goal of this network is to aid local indie VR developers in creating and monetizing their content, and to act as a resource and hub for the local public who wish to engage in virtual reality technology. For Singapore, we will be hosting this meetup in a physical location and link up to Asia Pacific VR network. Do bring your oculus rift and laptop with you to experience the meetup with other VR groups in Asia Pacific region. We will be projecting the APVPN via projector. So it is alright if you come in without Oculus Rift. Date: 25th of July Time: The event is estimated to go for 4 hours List of networked meetups; Manila, Philippines: 4pm (has speakers) Shanghai: 4pm (has speakers) Brisbane, Australia: 6pm (has speakers) Istanbul, Turkey: 11am (has speakers) Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia: 4pm Abu Dhabi, UAE: 12pm Indonesia: Singapore: 4pm Timeline: 0:00 - Arrive and setup for the event - Singapore Base will be providing some small nibbles. 1:00 - Brisbane has two speakers present for 30 min each 1:30 - Istanbul has two speakers for 30 min each 2:00 - Shanghai has two speakers for 30 min each 2:30 - Philippines has two speakers for 30 min each 7 to 8 pm SGT - Dinner and Network session. Yes, we will be providing dinner. List speaker presenting + topics: Lex Van Cooten (Brisbane) - Opening Remarks Sami Hamid (Istanbul) - ‘Will VR Work This Time?’ Richard Huang - Preserving History in VR Cristopher David - VR adoption in the developing world. Wilf Watson (Brisbane) - Open Source Mobile VR Project NOTE: (If possible) There should be VR booths (connected to the internet) setup away from the presentation area where meetup attendees may log in to VRChat/ConVRge to socialise with other individuals who have logged in from around the world. Meetup Details Asia Pacific VR Network: www.apvrn.com Brisbane, Australia: www.virtualrealitybrisbane.com Abu Dhabi, UAE: www.meetup.com/abu-dhabi-vr Singapore: www. meetup.com/sgvrar The meetup in Singapore is supported by the Enterprise Development Lab. About Enterprise Development Lab: The Enterprise Development Lab is a division within the Institute of Engineering Leadership. The Institute of Engineering Leadership is under the Faculty of Engineering of the National University of Singapore. The mission of the Enterprise Development Lab is to stimulate and support innovative enterprise development, through the active nurturing of innovation and entrepreneurship. Link up with us via this email: ethan@ nus.edu.sg
events.location: Park Mall Singapore #11-13, 9 Penang Road, Park Mall Singapore 238459 #11-13
events.group_name: SGVRAR - SG Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality meetup

events.name: DataScience SG Panel and Networking: "What makes a Data Scientist?"
events.description: Attention: Limited space at panel area (2nd floor) on a FIRST COME FIRST SERVED basis. Panel discussion will start at 7.00pm . Please change your RSVP if you're unable to attend. Thank you! We'll be switching it up for this month's meetup with a more casual panel discussion. Three Data Science Leads/Data Scientists from Grabtaxi, Lazada, and Rakuten will be sharing on "What makes a Data Scientist?" with Koo moderating. Our meetup will be held at 1925, a brewery along Jalan Besar (~1km from Farrer Park or Lavender MRT). They have kindly offered to host, and extend the happy hour promotion to, us from 7-8pm. We will end the panel promptly at 7.45pm and carry on chatting over craft beers =). Given that spaces are limited, please only RSVP if you're able to arrive punctually (you can drop by after 7.45 without RSVP-ing). Thank you! Directions: From Lavender MRT, walk towards and down Lavender Street. Turn left at Jalan Besar Street and look for 1925, which has a yellow shop front. From Farrer Park MRT, walk towards and down Serangoon Rd before turning right at Lavender Street. Then, turn right on Jalan Besar and look for 1925, which has a yellow shop front. Here's how 1925 looks like. Take the stairs up to the 2nd floor. Agenda: • 6.45pm - 7.00pm: Come early to get a good seat! • 7.00pm - 7.45pm: Panel Discussion on "What makes a Data Scientist?" • 7.45pm - 9pm: Closing and Networking over beers. About the panelists: • Ewa Szymanska (Rakuten) About Ewa: Ewa is the Head of Consumer Behaviour Lab at Rakuten Asia. Ewa is responsible for leveraging consumer data and understanding of consumer behaviours to inform global marketing strategy, empower merchants, and develop solutions for targeted online advertising. Prior to joining Rakuten’s Global Marketing Office in Singapore, Ewa was a Behavioural Data Scientist at SingTel – Singapore Telecommunications – applying a psychographic approach to analysing location data for targeted mobile advertising. Ewa received her PhD in Experimental Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania. LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/ewa-eva-szymanska-phd/a/656/276 • Gergely Dányi (Grabtaxi) About Greg: Greg is currently a data scientist with GrabTaxi. (More to come...) LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/pub/gergely-dányi/25/b43/6b7 ; • John Berns (Lazada) About John: John currently heads Lazada's Data Science team where he's involved in the ground-up implementation of data science & analytics capabilities, integrated data services and data platform for SE Asia's largest e-commerce company. LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jfxberns
events.location: 1925, 2nd Floor, 369 Jalan Besar Singapore 208997, Singapore

events.name: July Meetup
events.description: Hi folks! We look forward to having you join us for our July meetup, on the 28th, 7.00pm at Paypal (They moved so please take note of the changes in the address). We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Anna, Winston or Guo Xiang) if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips. See you on the 28th! Venue: PayPal Singapore office. 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 -------------- 1. "Beyond the MVC: An Object Taxonomy for Rails" by Ted Johansson / @drenmi 2. "Crystal Lang" by Grzegorz Witek @arnvald 3. * Hot Picks - This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone can stand up and say something interesting! * Open Source Issues Hot Picks - This is a 5 minutes session where I'll (Guo Xiang) share open source issues that people can work on. -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices, so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips" that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must have came across some interesting Ruby nuggets in the last month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com, or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com, or Guo Xiang @tgx_world or tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! -------------- Job Postings -------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting? Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks: Venue:
events.location: PayPal, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985, Singapore

events.name: July Drupal meetup: Drupal hosting & infrastructure
events.description: This July, we're gonna talk about one of the most important piece that is hardly discussed: Drupal hosting and infrastructure. We are honoured to have representatives from Pantheon and Bootdev coming all the way down to Singapore to share with us about the science behind planning for your Drupal infrastructure for scalability and performance. Dates are tentative but we're too excited to not share this with you guys now.
events.location: SmartSpace, 261 Waterloo Street, #03-32, Singapore 180261

events.name: WebSockets and RxJava night
events.description: Speaker: Sergi Almar Title: Realtime Web with Spring: SSE and WebSockets Abstract: Real-time has changed the way we interact with the web. Real-time applications mimic what we have in the real world, information as it happens being pushed to us. In this presentation you will learn how to build a more interactive and engaging user experience with Server-Sent Events and WebSockets. We will review the Spring Websocket architecture, the STOMP support, how to secure a WebSocket application and the new Spring 4.2 features. Speaker: Xavier Lepretre Title: Introduction to RxJava, with code examples Description: Functional Reactive Programming, and in particular its Java implementation, is well suited to applications that rely a lot on asynchronous calls and thread hopping. Discover the major coding elements of RxJava that will get you started. Non-developers may have their eyes glaze over by the 7th slide, though. Bio: Xavier has been coding on and off from the days of BASIC and Pascal, has used RxJava with Android at TradeHero for the past 7 months and did not look back.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Get ready for DevOpsDays!
events.description: We're delighted to bring you the first ever DevOpsDays to Singapore in October this year! In this meetup we would like to show you how DevOpsDays work, how you can contribute and make the best out of it. *DevOpsDays what?!* DevOpsDays is a 2-day unconference for DevOps-minded people like you that will be held in Singapore on October 16th and 17th, 2015. Date: October 16-17 2015 Location: Raffles City Convention Centre, Singapore Website: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/ *Why so special ah?* DevOpsDays are not the typical tech conference you might know. DevOpsDays follow a quite unique format and in this meetup we'd like to introduce you the core concepts of DevOpsDays. DevOpsDays work best when you step out of your comfort zone and contribute by asking questions, suggesting ideas for open spaces, talk etc. It's what *you* make out of it and we want to provide you the best environment for sharing, open discussions and having fun with like-minded people from all over the world. A lot of attendees report that their first DevOpsDays has been a career-changing experience (examples: https://www.google.com/search?q=devopsdays+review ). We aim high and believe that we can make this the best DevOps event in Asia. For that we would love to hear your feedback, questions and ideas upfront. *Sounds good… I have a question!* Just add a comment below to ask us all the questions. *Agenda* 18:45 Start – grab some great food from the buffet and enjoy a drink with others 19:15 *Talk: What is DevOpsDays & How is it special?* 19:35 Break 19:50 *Talk: Help you prepare a talk and OpenSpace for DevOpsDays* 20:05 Break 20:15 *Talk / Fishbowl: DevOpsDays FAQ* 21:00 End Food and drinks will be served.
events.location: Thoughtworks, 87B Amoy Street #04, Singapore 069906, Singapore

events.name: PyLadies SG July 2015 Meetup - Introduction to Python
events.description: Martin Brochhaus, one of PyCon SG's organizers, will join us and give a little presentation about how to install Python on Windows, OSX or Ubuntu. He will also show how to use the free editor Atom.io as a Python IDE and guide us through the first steps of writing a Python program.
events.location: PayPal office at 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985

events.name: Windows 10 Game Development
events.description: Guest Speaker Uditha Bandara will be flying from Srilanka to Singapore to speak in this Meetup. He is the first Xbox MVP in South East Asia. About Speaker: Uditha Bandara is specializes in .NET Game development for Windows Phone, Xbox and PC. He was the South East Asia’s First XNA/DirectX MVP (Most Valuable Professional). He had delivered sessions at various events and conferences in Singapore, Hong Kong,Malaysia Sri Lanka and India. He has published several articles,books, tutorials, and game demos on his XNA Game Development Blog – http://uditha.wordpress.com
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Talking about DATA, here are the specs Baby !
events.description: Data collection and evaluation has been the bane of my existence since i joined the IT fraternity. Data collection and streaming and statistics and visualizing and evaluating and reporting and what not! Everyone talks about Data collection, but its how you make sense of it that matters. A sea of Data points, but its mapping the currents that matter. The next Meetup for the Singapore Rasp Pi Enthusiasts will be about Data that is collected from our beloved Pi devices. This session is not going to be an exhaustive solution to DATA logging tasks, but hey, some discussion is sure to ensue.
events.location: Plug-in @ Blk 71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-18, Singapore

events.name: Python Meetup + PyCon SG 2016 Committee - July 2015
events.description: Hey everyone, we will be having a user meetup at the end of this July. In addition, we are looking for volunteers to help us make PyCon SG 2016 a reality. Come join us this evening to meet with the Python community in Singapore and be involved in our next conference! Venue: Red Hat 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore, Singapore Time: 7.30 - 9pm Agenda: - Martin Brochhaus: PyCon SG 2015 recap - Forming of PyCon SG 2016 Committee
events.location: Red Hat, 8 Shenton Way, 10-01 AXA Tower, 068811 Singapore

events.name: Amateur Radio July Meetup
events.description: Amateur Radio, or Ham Radio, is a hobby with activities involving communication via radio waves. Most enthusiasts are fascinated with operating radio transmitters, receivers and antennas or how radio waves are able to get from one corner of the earth to another.
events.location: Alumni Medical Centre, No.2 College Road, Singapore 169850

events.name: Haskell mentorship
events.description: We will go on With Learn You a Haskell, benefitting from Sönke's tutorial on algebraic datatypes from July 21st.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Open House:  100th Year Anniversary of Datwyler & SG50
events.description: To celebrate Datwyler 100th Year Anniversary and SG50, we invite you to come to Datwyler Open House on Aug 6 at any time between 11am to 5pm. This is to be held on the eve of long SG national holiday from Aug 7-10. We will provide tour to its facility (office, demo room, warehouse, workshop). Datwyler is the Swiss manufacturer of structured cabling and elevator cabling. Singapore has been the logistics hub for Asia since 1996. Datwyler is among few reputable MNCs that have its own full-fledged operation to support customers. We handles orders, warehousing, delivery, customer services by ourselves. Each product that we ship out is 100% tested and not merely pass sampling test. Each local staff has been well-trained towards Swiss quality of product, innovation and customer services. The Open House is to give a rare opportunity for you to look & feel its facility. You may come anytime between 11am to 5pm on Thu, Aug 6, and spend whatever time you prefer. We invite you to join lunch or drinks together with us. Then we will give you a tour to our facility and demo room. If time is permitted for you, you could join some talks from us and our partners on data centre technologies, structured cabling, GPON, Wireless Access Point system, data centre physical security system, fire protection, and so on. For those tech entrepreneurs who like to seek business opportunities in data centre, structured cabling, wireless, networking, we will provide a talk on how we can provide resources and supports for you. You will receive a special edition of celebration gift from Datwtyler.
events.location: Datwyler, 30 Toh Guan Road #01-01A (Opp IMM, near Furniture Mall).  , Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: Ryoji Ikeda: Supercodex Thursday 20 August, 8pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 Tickets: $12/$10 (students). Purchase here: http://bit.ly/1HB0JQP Concept, composition: Ryoji Ikeda Computer graphics, programming: Tomonaga Tokuyama PREPARE TO BE IMMERSED IN A MULTI-SENSORIAL EXTRAVAGANZA. Sonic artist, visual artist, electronic composer and computer-musician in one, Ryoji Ikeda has gained international renown for his provocative work combining visuals and sound. ArtScience Museum is delighted to host the performance of Ikeda’s supercodex [live set], which reworks musical concepts from Ikeda’s 2013 superposition piece, which investigates how we understand the reality of nature on an atomic scale, taking its starting point in mathematical models and quantum mechanics. supercodex [live set] begins subtly, with digital noise, blips and bass drones, from which gradually emerges the core elements of techno and dance music, where Ikeda uses raw data and mathematical models to generate music and projections. Don’t miss this extraordinary live performance, where the accompanying visuals add to the rich textures to merge the senses, creating an unforgettable experience. For more information please visit: http://www.ryojiikeda.com/archive/concerts/#supercodex_live_set Part of the Soundislands Festival http://soundislands.com/si15/
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Conversations: “~sound:senses”
events.description: “~sound:senses” Saturday 22nd August 2015 2.15pm to 5.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE What is the colour of sound? Does the shape of the plate change the taste of the cake? This August, join us as leading artists and scientists in the fields of psychology, sound art, perception, and multimodal design come together to explore how sound acts as the glue connecting our sensorial experiences and interactions. Guest speakers include luminaries such as interaction designer, Stefania Serafin, crossmodality researcher Charles Spence, composer Joyce Beetuan Koh, filmmaker Daniel Belton, and psycholinguist Suzy Styles. Chairing the panel is ArtScience Museum Executive Director, Honor Harger. Closing the event is Black Zenith, who will be performing Microsaccades; a culmination of sound, live visuals and video. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, initiated by PerMagnus Lindborg with support from CLASS and ADM at Nanyang Technological University, the Italian Institute of Culture, and the Arts Council of New Zealand.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Sunday Showcase
events.description: Sunday Showcase allows visitors unique access to cutting edge projects being undertaken by different tertiary institutions across Singapore. The series invites the creators and their work into ArtScience Museum on a Sunday each month. The creators are on hand throughout the afternoon to talk with visitors about their inventions, their creative process, and to facilitate visitors' interaction with the projects. There is something for everyone in this hands-on, accessible showcase series. Sunday 23rd August 2015 10am to 6.30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE “~sound:senses” Sound is the medium that acts as the glue between the senses, intertwining hearing, vision and movement. This Sunday Showcase, we invite you to dive into a coral reef of artworks and scientific demonstrations by international artists and researchers who have mapped out crossmodal associations with touch, smell, feel, and taste. “~sound:senses” will feature sound installations, experimental films, robotic sculptures, mobile media, web audio solutions, as well as workshops on electroacoustic sounds led by experts. The event is part of the Soundislands Festival, with support from Nanyang Technological University.
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing? Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it? Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too. Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people. See you folks!
events.location: Hackerspace, 344B King George's Avenue, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #012
events.description: Paper #1 - Worker/Wrapper/Makes It/Faster: Laurence Day : http://www.cs.nott.ac.uk/~jph/wwmf.pdf Paper #2 - Robust Range-Only Beacon Localization : Ashish Raste - https://people.csail.mit.edu/teller/pubs/robl.pdf ------------------- What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss. ----------------- Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: The PowerShell Conference 2015, Asia
events.description: PowerShell Conference Asia 2015 is coming up fast so here’s a quick update on all the incredible speakers we’ve got lined up already. After we sent out the call for Speakers and Sponsors we had an awesome response. We’ve had Community Members, MVPs and even the PowerShell Product Team put their hand up to be there and present the latest and greatest in PowerShell to you. Now that we’re rapidly approaching the second half of the year a lot of people have been contacting us keen to know how they can register. We’ve been really overwhelmed with interest and support from the whole APAC Community, so thank you for that. Here’s an overview of the current arrangements and plans Platinum Sponsor We are extremely pleased to announce officially that SAPIEN Technologies are going to be our platinum sponsor for this event! SAPIEN have long supported the PowerShell community and make some of the best tools on the market. With amazing folks like David Corales, Ferdinand Rios and June Blender, SAPIEN are hugely influential in the PowerShell community, we can't thank them enough for helping to make this event happen. SAPIEN will be present for both days and we look forward to welcoming them. If you can arrange to stay an extra day you’ll be able to experience the excitement of the Singapore F1 Grand Prix. What a way to wrap up the week! What about Registration? Registration: We have opened up Registration on EventBrite and you can find it here: https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/powershell-conference-asia-2015-tickets-17336891108 We are accepting payment by PayPal and registration is not confirmed until payment is made. For this awesome event we are asking a US$200 registration fee. So what do you get for your money? • 2 full days of intense sessions with international speakers • Breakfast, lunch and afternoon tea on both days • T-Shirt and sponsor giveaways • Entry to the Closing Party on Saturday evening (food & drinks included) • Connect with other PowerShell enthusiasts in the region • Network with peers, MVPs, speakers and the PowerShell Team! If you have any questions or need help arranging travel and accommodation details please let us know. We’re really excited to see you all there in September. ** DISCLAIMER **: By registering through MeetUp is just an indicative on knowing which peers will be attending within the group which will be beneficial to learn together. You will need to register through EventBrite and have the confirmation email before you are allow in the event! Lastly, we have limited seats! So do hurry up!
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989
